result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:32 PM Prosecuting attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Lindsay April Weisbrod in court.  Attorney Anne Renc in court for Lindsay April Weisbrod. 
Cases heard at this time are 21CF-513, 22CF-1, 22CF-22 and 22CF-216. 

Court calls cases.
Atty Mutchler states appearances.

Matters are set for a waived preliminary hearing.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT:
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Bond continued.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued is continued in 22CF216.
22CF22 and 22CF1 bond is continued.
21CF513 bond is continued. 
Defendant can be released from custody on the determination of her being competent.

9:49 AM Defendant Lindsay April Weisbrod in court, in custody.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Robert Jambois appears on behalf of DA Louis John Molepske Jr. for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Anne Renc in court for Lindsay April Weisbrod. 
Cases heard today are 22CF1, 22CF22 and 21CF513.
One additional case added 22CF216.

Atty Anne Renc calls the cases and states the appearances.
This is set for a Status Hearing.
Court had previously ordered a competency evaluation and had been filed on June 7, 2022.
Evaluator states that the defendant has been determined to proceed.
Defendant is in agreement with the findings showing she is competent.
State does not plan on contesting the competency.
Neither party has an issue with the Court using the findings of the evaluator to determine the defendant competent.
Court questions the prosecution in these matters.

BY THE COURT:
Defendant is competent.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
10:07 AM Defendant Lindsay April Weisbrod not in court, Attorney Anne Renc for Lindsay April Weisbrod appeared in court, Attorney Louis John Molepske Jr. for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. 
Cases heard today are 21CF513 and 22CF1.

Court calls the case.
DA Molepske states the appearances.
Defendant fails to appear; she is not in custody.
Atty Renc does not know where her client may be her last contact was on March 7, 2022.
Court makes statements to the parties.
DA Molepske would request a bench warrant for the defendant's failure to appear.
DA Molepske would ask that any cash bonds be forfeited.
Cash bond in the amount of $500.
Atty Renc would ask that the bond not be forfeited.
DA Molepske is pulling up the competency evaluation in Court.
Atty Renc briefly reviewed this with her client on March 7, 2022.

BY THE COURT:
Bench Warrant for defendant's arrest.
Cash bond posted in 21CF513 be forfeited.

10:11 a.m.  Defendant now appears she was in the incorrect branch.

BY THE COURT:
Bench warrants will not be issued.
Cash bond not to be forfeited.

DA Molepske was able to review the competency evaluation.
Court qustions DA Molepske is he has a response with regards to the competency.
DA Molepske makes statements and indicates that the defendant can be restored to competency.
Atty Renc states that her client maintains that she is not competent.
Both parties are in agreement that the report is acceptable and that the defendant is not competent.

BY THE COURT:
Defendant is determined to be incompetent.
With appropriate medication and treatment can be restored back to competency within a specific amount of time.
Incompetent on both cases.
Shall be referred to the Department of Health Services and be re-examined at 3, 6, 9 months and 30 days prior to the 12 months terminating.
Sheriff's Department to provide transport.
Does not need to be held in an institution at this time while the DHS determines her placement.
Both cases to be suspended at this time.
Status Report from JusticePoint dated 03/18/22

3:34 PM Attorney Anne Renc appeared in court for Lindsay April Weisbrod, Attorney Louis John Molepske Jr. appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Renc requests theses cases be held with the competency hearing. Matters rescheduled.

records.addlTxt: Anne Renc
Initial appearance on January 24, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

02:23 PM Defendant Lindsay April Weisbrod not in court.   Defendant is at Winnebago Mental Health Facility.  Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelly A Cassidy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 21CF513 and 22CF1.

ADA Cassidy makes statements that the defendant did not receive the complaints.
Defendant is currently being held at Winnebago Mental Health.
Cases are to be adjourned as the defendant has not received copies of the complaints.
Atty Renc states that her client has the money to post her bond.
Atty Renc provides her phone # to the defendant and informs her to contact her on 01/04/22 to discuss these cases.
Atty Renc still has a competency issue with her client.
Court makes statements as to why the defendant is at Winnebago Mental Health.

BY THE COURT:
Cases are adjourned.  Initial appearance scheduled for January 24, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Dodge appears in court. Atty Bergner appears for the defendant.
Defendant appears from jail by video. 

ADA Dodge states facts for anticipated charges of Felony Bail Jumping. 
Defendant makes statements regarding the facts of this case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

State requests a $500 cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Bergner makes bond arguments. 
Court makes statements.

BY THE COURT:
$1000 Signature Bond.
Do not call 911 unless there is an actual, imminent emergency.
Participate in the Portage County Justice Program to be assessed. Comply with programming as deemed necessary.
If defendant has a social worker, they are to contact them and request assistance.

Initial Appearance scheduled for:  01-03-2022  @ 1:30 p.m. in Branch 2.
